image.altText: a piece of paper is stuck to a shop window with yellow tape

props.synopsis: Shop owners in the northern Victorian town of Swan Hill say they are concerned after a threatening note was left outside a store selling tobacco, demanding the owner "contact the commission".

title.children: Tobacco shop owner 'refuses to cooperate' with police despite shakedown sign

image.altText: Woman staring at camera while standing next to a window

props.synopsis: In every Australian state and the NT, churches cannot be held vicariously liable for historical child sexual abuse perpetrated by their priests. Grace Tame is leading the charge for change.

title.children: Grace Tame fights against a legal loophole frustrating abuse survivors

image.altText: Damien Richardson.

props.synopsis: Damien Richardson agreed to a restorative justice program, which will require him to apologise to the Jewish community and attend therapy.

title.children: Ex-Neighbours star Damien Richardson sentenced over Nazi gesture

image.altText: A burned truck on a burne out area

props.synopsis: A Country Fire Authority crew was forced to call for help after their tanker broke down while fighting an emergency level blaze near Benalla.

title.children: Multiple fire trucks broke down during emergency level blaze in Victoria

image.altText: Chris Scott looks on before the 2025 AFL grand final

props.synopsis: Already the longest serving coach in Geelong history, Chris Scott's new deal with the club will put him in the company of some of the AFL's greatest ever mentors.

title.children: History beckons for Scott after new deal

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving, saying the incident left her "disappointed and embarrassed".

title.children: Victorian premier's husband caught drink driving

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house with a grey tin roof, white weatherboard and white fencing.

props.synopsis: Jodie Hill wept as a Supreme Court jury found her not guilty of murder and manslaughter, follow a week of deliberations.

title.children: Regional Victorian found not guilty of murder walks free despite jail cell admission

image.altText: People walking horses away from the fire in a dusty paddock

props.synopsis: One house and six sheds have been lost in a fire started by farm machinery at Goomalibee, near north-east Victorian town Benalla.

title.children: House lost in fire sparked by harvest machinery

image.altText: A short white pony wearing a Christmas hat receives pats from a blonde woman.

props.synopsis: A Welsh Shetland cross pony is spreading festive cheer — and stirring memories — during visits to an aged care home in eastern Victoria.

title.children: Pony brings Christmas cheer to aged care home

image.altText: Green Kenworth truck driving alongside parked suburban cars in a town.

props.synopsis: A western Victorian council says plans for a bypass might finally eventuate, as thousands of trucks travel through the city of Horsham each day amid an industrial boom.

title.children: Victorian council hopes bypass might finally happen after 80-year wait

image.altText: An old photo of a woman in a brown nun's habit.

props.synopsis: Former nun Mary Hughes alleges she was subjected to multiple forms of abuse during her 60 years at a Carmelite monastery in Melbourne.

title.children: Mary was looking for a noble life. Instead, she says she was caught in a fringe group

image.altText: A silhouetted corrections officer walks down a cell corridor in a prison.

props.synopsis: Police will be trusted to decide whether their own conduct was illegal during a secret prison bugging program, with prosecutors saying they will only reassess cases the force flags for review.

title.children: Police to decide on the legality of their own secret prison wiretaps

image.altText: An aerial photo of police and police vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police have again been called to the Melbourne bayside suburb of Mordialloc, a day after reports of a brawl involving more than 100 teenagers.

title.children: Police called to Melbourne bayside suburb again as large group gathers

image.altText: Two people in construction hats look at a drilling rig.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government approves two companies to drill deep underground exploration tunnels amid a gold "renaissance" driven by high gold prices.

title.children: Mining exploration heads underground in Victoria amid gold 'renaissance'

image.altText: A man with short buzzed red hair wears dark grey-blue surgical scrubs while sitting in front of a laptop at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

title.children: Practice conditions put on neurosurgeon after behaviour complaints

image.altText: Craig Freeman leaving court

props.synopsis: Craig Freeman was charged last month with murder over the death of his wife Melinda in October 1991.

title.children: Husband charged with cold case murder of Melinda Freeman granted bail

image.altText: An aerial photo of a busy construction site for the Suburban Rail Loop station in Burwood.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government turns to developer contributions and car park levies as it tries to raise more than $10 billion in funding for the first stage of the Suburban Rail Loop.

title.children: Developers, car park owners to fund major Melbourne transport project

image.altText: A graphic showing newspaper headlines

props.synopsis: Silvagni employed a legal team exclusively to fight for a suppression order, preventing his name from being reported by the media for more than a year.

title.children: How Tom Silvagni kept his name out of headlines before rape conviction

image.altText: A police car.

props.synopsis: A man will face court on Thursday following the fatal assault of a man in Cheltenham on Tuesday night.

title.children: Man charged with murder after fatal assault in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Victorian police officer from behind.

props.synopsis: The latest statistics show crime in Victoria is at its highest level since the Crime Statistics Agency started keeping records 20 years ago.

title.children: Victoria's crime rate continues to climb despite government measures

image.altText: Tracy Beaton smiles, has hands in pockets of black pants, wears glasses, green and beige printed shirt.

props.synopsis: The Allan Labor government has appointed Tracy Beaton to head the Commission for Children and Young People, as Victoria continues to grapple with its childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian children's commissioner appointed after nine-month vacancy

image.altText: A fire seen through a window.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the cause of a house fire which has left one man fighting for life in hospital and several other people injured.

title.children: Man critically injured in suspicious house fire in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Three CFA officers and one police officer stand at the edge of a burnt house crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man who pleaded guilty to arson after lighting a fire that killed his housemate has been jailed for 11 years. A Supreme Court justice said his actions were "extremely dangerous" and unsophisticated.

title.children: Arsonist sentenced to 11 years in prison for fire that killed housemate

image.altText: crash scene on rural road

props.synopsis: A teenage boy and a 51-year-old woman from Papua New Guinea have been identified as victims of a fatal crash in Northern Victoria.

title.children: PNG community seeking support to repatriate victims of minivan crash

image.altText: Exterior of the fitzroy community school - a brick building painted with a mural of rolling fields with a sunset

props.synopsis: The school that inspired author John Marsden is facing potential legal action from parents over allegations of physical abuse.

title.children: Parents threaten legal action over abuse allegations at 'cult-like' school

image.altText: A view of the newly opened West Gate Tunnel taken by a drone.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited West Gate Tunnel project, designed to transform Melbourne's west by diverting thousands of freight trucks, is officially open to travellers.

title.children: Melbourne's West Gate Tunnel opens, with promise to transform travel in city's west

image.altText: Loose leaf spinach from Bulmer's farm in a box

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Ombudsman has accused Bulmer Farms in Victoria's East Gippsland region of underpaying migrant workers more than $645,000.

title.children: Victorian vegetable farmer accused of underpaying migrant workers

image.altText: A yacht in the water seen from a rescue helicopter.

props.synopsis: Police release video showing two men being winched to safety after abandoning their yacht in rough seas off Lakes Entrance.

title.children: Sailors rescued from yacht off Victoria's coast

image.altText: crash scene on rural road

props.synopsis: Four passengers in a van, who are yet to be formally identified, died at the scene, north of Shepparton in Victoria. Five injured people, including three children and the male driver, were taken to various hospitals.

title.children: Four killed in Victorian crash may have been farm workers, police say

image.altText: Samantha Hind lies in bed in a hospital wearing a neck brace.

props.synopsis: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

title.children: After being run over by a car while sunbaking, Sam reunites with paramedics who saved her

image.altText: Smoke rises from a metal bowl as people painted with ochre watch on.

props.synopsis: Victoria's statewide treaty has officially launched with a day of cultural celebrations in Melbourne.

title.children: Victoria's historic treaty formally commences with cultural celebration

image.altText: Bendigo writers festival signs with the capital theatre in the background

props.synopsis: The debate around the failed Bendigo Writers Festival, which will not run next year, again embroils sponsor La Trobe University in controversy amid calls for more transparency and accountability.

title.children: Bendigo Writers Festival debacle continues as sponsor is asked to apologise

image.altText: a newsagency shop front with crack in top wall and advertising along facade

props.synopsis: Twenty-five London plane trees are set to be removed from Hamilton after they were found to be causing problems with local infrastructure.

title.children: London plane trees to be cut down in main street of Victorian city

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue lab clothing look at a brain scan on a computer.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest brain research centre is suing one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

title.children: Brain research centre sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: The young woman raped by Tom Silvagni, whose father is AFL great Stephen Silvagni, has described the horror of the night it happened and the lasting impact it has had on her life.

title.children: Tom Silvagni's victim haunted by rape 'every single day', court told
